div.p: Hi my name is Debbie Boros the Dean of Lifelong Learning.
Congratulations on your decision to return to school,
welcome to the access program and DeSales University.
Many of you have had a 5, 10 or 15 year hiatus from going back to school.
As a new student you're full of enthusiasm and maybe just a little anxiety
and hesitation even before you step in to the virtual or face to face classroom.
So we wanted to create a special orientation experience tailored to meet your diverse needs.
We value and respect your life experiences so it is important
that this orientation is relevant to adult learners.
The goal of the orientation is not to burden you with on policies and procedures
that will push you to the threshold of information overload but to provide you
with strategies for academic success.
For example: how is your life going to change?
Where will you go if you need some resources or services?
How are you going to learn to use the technology?
The orientation will cover all of these answers and more including registration,
how to write a research paper and yes, even how to get through that much dreaded math course
and you will be able to interact with one another, with staff and with future professors.
You will get to meet some of our current students who will talk about their experiences
and challenges in the access program and they will give you some good tips on how
to juggle family, work, community commitments and school.
So please take your time as you go through the orientation, we can go in and out and use it
as a future reference but please take the time to complete the orientation.
It's important to understand the program so that you can focus on your studies instead
of worrying about deadlines or misinterpreted policies.
Most importantly, get to know your advisor they understand the challenges of returning to school
as an adult learner, so take advantage of their knowledge, guidance and support.
I really enjoy meeting and talking with students and finding out how they are doing
in the program so I hope you'll take a few minutes to stop in and say hello to me.
I look forward to meeting you.
I wish you much success in your academic endeavors.
Thank you again for putting your education in the hands of access.
Please take care.
